item-education.description: Exchange student in software engineering and computer science
item-education.additional-info: Graduating with the equivalent of a Master Degree in Computer Science

extra.extraContent: This is when I started to discover an interest for programming. On my free time I started to work on my first website, using Ruby on Rails. You can still find it at old.jeremydagorn.com.

institution.name: Engineering School of University of Nantes

item-education.description: Student in Software Engineering and Networks.
item-education.additional-info: Graduated with the equivalent of a Master Degree in Computer Science

extra.extraContent:
Fun fact: my first Android app was a shopping list application for a school project.
Done in collaboration with @atomrc at the time.

item-education.additional-info: Graduated with a Bachelor Degree in Computer Science with honors

item-work.achievements: Member of the universal shopping cart team. I add features and help maintain several of our microservices in PHP/Laravel. Some of my other responsibilities include APIs integration (external merchants), and continuous integration pipeline for one-click deployment in our different QA environments, using Jenkins and Docker.

Full-stack engineer, first engineer to join. Working on front-end and backend development to drive acquisition and retention of users. During my time there, I reimplemented a complex signup flow using Ember.js, introduced the company to React.js and Redux, and setup the initial Jenkins pipeline for our continous integration. I also worked a lot on improving our test coverage, through unit tests but also integration tests using Cucumber. Some of the React projects I worked on were a support center for our users, and an inventory management solution for our fulfillment team (Web app and React Native mobile app acting as a bottle scanner).

During my two years at Prezi, I have been part of several teams. I started as a developer in charge of implementing new features for the Prezi editor, in order to increase the number of reccurring users. Then, I joined the Collaboration team where I implemented complex user interfaces and new features for real time editing and presenting of Prezi presentations. I also joined the Javascript team where I worked on implementing a UI framework for other developers including a lot of architectural decisions.

extra.extraContent:
I learned so much during my time there. From testing to continuous deployment.
Some technologies and tools that I used:
  • Jenkins
  • Pig/Hadoop
  • Cucumber
  • Gradle

item-projects.title: Developer for iheartreading.co
item-projects.description: I have been working on I Heart Reading for a bit more than a year now. It is a platform helping teachers and students to keep track of their readings. It also gives the ability for teachers to get a clear picture of the progress made by their students, through a simple interface. Students can mark books as read and write reviews that their teachers can approve. I have one school in San Diego using it for the second year now. I started it from scratch as a way to improve my skills in Laravel and React. Some of the upcoming features would be books recommendations and adding some gamificiation to make reading logs more fun to use.

item-projects.title: Maintainer of several open-source projects
item-projects.description: On my free time, I work on various open-source projects of my own. Those mostly includes small packages, easy to integrate. For example, this resume is generated through a npm package of my own called json-resume-dynamic. I have also a markdown editor with preview implemented in React.js that is currently used in production at Curology. I am also maintaining Reddit and Cloudinary API wrappers for Laravel, available as composer packages. ANother project is a small npm package to help you generate a calendar showing all your Bitbucket and Github contributions as a React component, easy to display on your website.

item-hobbies.name: Functional programming
item-hobbies.additional-info: I have a growing interest for functional programming - Haskell/Elm

extra.extraContent: One of my favorite author is Stephane Bourgoin.
